intro: Arum vulgare var. albovenosum, commonly known as the white-veined arum, is a variant of the common arum characterized by its distinctive white veins on its leaves. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe, particularly the British Isles. The plant features a spadix surrounded by a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped with a smooth margin and a glossy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
